basic_info.description: My name is Brenden Moore, a recent graduate of Code Fellows bootcamp. What sets me apart from other devs is my creativity. Coming up with ideas and work arounds are key to keeping a steady work flow during a project, as well as coming up with and incorperating ideas to better your users experience and interactability. Afterall, every project starts out as an idea, and every idea starts starts with creativity.

projects.title: Battle Dice
projects.description: Battle Dice was my biggest project yet, made with 4 other devs for my 201 final project. The concept of Battle Dice is a simple dice rolling game, where the user puts in some data like their name and blood type, and plays against a bot to see who gets a higher roll. The user can also specify what dice they want to play with, and view their old role data through the use of local storage. Battle Dice is taking over!!!

projects.title: Gallery-Of-Horns
projects.description: Gallery-of-horns was my first React based website. Using JS and BootStrap, this app is a collection of ccards that have information about horned beasts. The user can favorite beasts they like the most and view bigger images of the beasts, as well as filter through beasts with certain amounts of horns.

projects.title: Salmon-Cookies
projects.description: Salmon Cookies was a big project in my 201 course, going over the use of DOM manipulation. This was a fake site selling the ever popular salmon cookie. The main feature of salmon cookies was a seperate page with sales data, and the user could use the DOM to make new locations with average sales.
